metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12363 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low.
metadata.Description:
Improper input validation in some Intel(R) Graphics Drivers for Windows* before version 26.20.100.7212 and before Linux kernel version 5.5 may allow a privileged user to potentially enable a denial of service via local access.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12363` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-37-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-6.2.0-37-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-37-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-37-generic-64k - 5.15.0-25.25
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1016-aws - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1016-azure - 5.15.0-1003.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1018-gcp - 5.15.0-1003.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1010-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1017-kvm - 5.15.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1017-lowlatency - 5.15.0-24.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1017-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-24.24
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1015-oracle - 5.15.0-1002.4
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1017-raspi - 5.15.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-37-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-6.2.0-37-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-37-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-37-generic-64k - 5.15.0-25.25
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> per Intel, this was fixed by a firmware update. v49.0.1 of the firmware is required. The new firmware requires a kernel patch: c784e5249e773689e38d2bc1749f08b986621a26
